info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 08 at 5:30PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Schenectady, northwestern Albany, southwestern Saratoga and northeastern Schoharie Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 530 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Central Bridge, or 9 miles east of Cobleskill, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Schenectady, Clifton Park, Rotterdam, Scotia, Glenville, Niskayuna, Duanesburg, Altamont, Schoharie, Delanson, Rotterdam Junction, East Glenville, Burnt Hills, Country Knolls, Alplaus, Central Bridge, Pattersonville-Rotterdam Junction, Halfmoon, Charlton and Princetown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 88 between exits 23 and 25. Interstate 90 between exits 25 and 26. Interstate 890 between exits 1a and 9. Interstate 87 between exits 8A and 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM EDT for east central New York.
